intro: Bugranopsis mitissima, commonly known as the soft bugranopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers come in shades of white and pink. Bugranopsis mitissima is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
